meanings.definition: A protein produced by the thyroid gland.
meanings.sent1: Thyroglobulin is a substance made by the thyroid gland.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can check the levels of thyroglobulin to understand thyroid health.
meanings.sent3: The thyroglobulin protein decided to throw a party in the thyroid gland.
meanings.sent4: In the body's orchestra, thyroglobulin plays the role of a thyroid gland musician.
meanings.sent5: Imagine thyroglobulin as a tiny worker diligently produced by the thyroid gland.

meanings.definition: A marker used in blood tests to evaluate thyroid function.
meanings.sent1: When the doctor ordered blood tests, they included thyroglobulin as a marker.
meanings.sent2: The level of thyroglobulin in the blood can indicate how well the thyroid is working.
meanings.sent3: During the blood test, thyroglobulin decided to do a little dance under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: Thyroglobulin in the blood test results is like a compass guiding the evaluation of thyroid function.
meanings.sent5: The presence of thyroglobulin in the blood test results stood out like a bright beacon for the doctors.
